title: Gallery Conversation: Kanga Cloths—East African Culture, Design, and Fashion
hero_caption: Kanga, early or mid-20th century. Zanzibar, Tanzania. Vedder and Price Fund.
short_description: Join Janet Purdy, associate curator of textiles, for a discussion of the history of the colorful, industrially-printed textiles known as kanga and the social and cultural symbolism expressed in their designs and proverbs. Explore eight works on display in the African galleries spanning five countries.
